intro: Micropholis resinifera, commonly known as the resinous micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is known for its ability to exude a resinous sap, which gives it its common name. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
